title: 3 Quick Ways to Know if Someone Deleted You on Snapchat

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. It's a yellow-and-white ghost icon. You'll know if someone deleted you as a friend if they're no longer in your friend list. Snapchat doesn't send notifications when friends are removed, so you'll need to check manually.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. This is in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Tap My Friends.
steps.content: Tap My Friends . You can find this under the Friends header.

steps.title: Search for the user.
steps.content: Search for the user. You can use the search bar at the top or scroll down to find them. If you don't see the user in your friend list and you haven't deleted them, they've most likely unfriended you. However, it's also possible they have deleted their Snapchat account .

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. It's a yellow-and-white ghost icon. You can see if someone deleted you by checking their Snapscore.

steps.title: Navigate to the user's profile.
steps.content: Navigate to the user's profile. Tap the magnifying glass in the top-left corner and enter their username. Then, tap their username to view their profile.

steps.title: View the Snap Score.
steps.content: View the Snap Score . You can find this number underneath the user's name. [1] X Research source If you can't see the Snap Score, the person probably deleted you; however, enabling certain privacy settings can also prevent the Snap Score from appearing. If you want to be 100 percent sure that the person deleted you, send a test snap .

steps.title: Tap the Camera button.
steps.content: Tap the Camera button. This is next to the chat and phone icon.

steps.title: Send a photo Snap.
steps.content: Send a photo Snap . Once you're finished, tap the arrow.

steps.title: Refresh the Chat tab.
steps.content: Refresh the Chat tab. Initially, you'll see a red arrow appear under the person's name, signifying that your snap has been sent. You can then tap and drag down the screen and then release it to refresh the page. If the red arrow turns into a grey arrow with the word Pending below it, your friend has deleted you from their friend list. You may have to refresh the page a few times before the grey Pending arrow displays. If the arrow stays red even after a few refreshes, your friend didn't delete you.
